title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings:
Watermark: scrollwork escutcheon with dove over triple mount, above crown, below G A
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Variation of the scheme of -1534. The arch at left is decorated  in the scheme of -1532. A semi-circular painting of classical monuments is inscribed in an oblong panel and flanked by gaines, shown in profile, supporting festoons. The central with a bust portrait is transferred over the panel.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1538.
